string-array.name: easy_facts
string-array.item: Australia is the sixth largest nation after Russia, Canada, China, the United States of America and Brazil. It has, however, a relatively small population.
Brazil is the largest country in South America.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
If China imported just 10%% of it\'s rice needs- the price on the world market would increase by 80%%.
Cuba is home to over 11 million people and is the most populous island nation in the Caribbean.
Nearly 84%% of the population of the UK lives in England, mainly in the major cities and metropolitan areas.
Nearly 20%% of the territory of France lies outside Europe. These regions are known as "DOM-TOM" (overseas departments and territories), where over 2.5 million French citizens live.
Germany is Europe\'s second largest populous nation. It is also Europe\'s largest economy.
Israel has the highest ratio of university degrees to the population in the world.
The colors of the Italian flag represent the three cardinal virtues: Green - hope; White - faith; Red - charity.
Christopher Columbus was the first European to visit Jamaica in 1494 and called it "the fairest island that eyes have beheld."
More than a thousand earthquakes hit Japan every year. Japan also has about 200 volcanoes, 60 of which are active.

South Korea has one of the strongest economies in Eastern Asia. Most of its wealth comes from manufacturing and service industries, such as banking. It exports ships, cars, computers, and other electronic items.
Mexico\'s ancient societies built great cities and huge pyramids, created remarkable works of art, and even studied the stars and planets to determine when to plant crops and hold ceremonies.

Russia, the largest country in the world, occupies one-tenth of all the land on Earth. It spans 11 time zones across two continents (Europe and Asia) and has coasts on three oceans (the Atlantic, Pacific, and Arctic).

Spaniards are known for their love of life and for eating and drinking with family and friends. Traditional appetizers like tapas or pintxos, the Basque country equivalent, are popular. Regional dances and music are almost as important as soccer and religious festivals.
Switzerland has one of the lowest crime rates of all industrialised countries.

Turkey is home to one of the earliest settlements in the world. Built 8,800 years ago, Catal Hoyuk was a labyrinth of 150 mud homes joined together. There were no streets in between, so people had to enter the homes through holes in the roof!

The United Kingdom, also called the U.K., consists of a group of islands off the northwest coast of Europe. It is a unique country made up of four nations: England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland. England, Wales, and Scotland also make up Great Britain.
The United States consumes 25%% of all the world\'s energy.

string-array.name: medium_facts
string-array.item: Argentina is a vast country located in the southern part of South America. The eighth largest country in the world, it is the second largest country in South America after Brazil, and it\'s about one-third the size of the United States.
Austria is one of the most forested countries in Europe with almost half its territory covered in forest—and forested area is increasing steadily thanks to Austria\'s "green lung" projects.

Much of Belarus (formerly the Belorussian Soviet Socialist Republic of the USSR, and then Byelorussia) is a hilly lowland with forests, swamps, and numerous rivers and lakes. There are wide rivers emptying into the Baltic and Black seas. Its forests cover over one-third of the land and its peat marshes are a valuable natural resource.
There are over 800 kinds of beers made in Belgium. Belgians consume in average 150 liters of beer per person per year.
The name Bulgaria has been kept after Bulgar people, who arrived here in the late seventh century.
Bolivia has had more than 190 revolutions and coups since it became independent in 1825. The latest constitution was adopted in 1967.
Bosnia and Herzegovina make up a triangular-shaped republic, about half the size of Kentucky, on the Balkan peninsula.

About 40 percent of the Chile\'s population lives in the area around the capital of Santiago. Children in rural areas need to wake up at 5:00 - 6:00 am to walk to school or meet the bus. Their journeys sometimes take two hours each way.
Colombia is nicknamed the "gateway to South America" because it sits in the northwestern part of the continent where South America connects with Central and North America.
Costa Rica is a little country which is often called the "Switzerland of Central America". In 2009 Costa Rica was named the happiest country among all Americas (Northern, Central, and Southern).
In Croatia, people can start voting at the age of 16, if they have a job, but have to wait until they turn 18, if they are unemployed.

The Czech capital, Prague, is more than 1 000 years old and has a wealth of historic architecture of different styles. Because of this, the city has become a favoured location for many international film makers.
In Denmark, it rains every second day. On average, a year has 171 days with a precipitation of more than 0.1mm). In 2007, however, there were 188 days of precipitation.
Finland is ranked as the least corrupt country in the world.
The colors of the Flag Blue and White symbolize the blue of the Hellenic Sea and the Whiteness of its restless waves.
Hungary is one of the oldest countries in Europe, founded way back in the year 896.

Iceland has vast amounts of water because it rains so much. Icelandic water is so clean and pure that it is piped into the city and to the kitchen taps in the home without any treatment (no chlorination needed).
With a population of over 1 billion, India is home to 400 million children, the largest number in any country in the world.
The former name of Iran was Persia, which was in use till 1935. The word Iran means the ‘Land of the Aryan’s.
Iraq occupies the ancient region of Mesopotamia, "land amidst the rivers," a fertile lowland created by the Tigris and Euphrates Rivers.
Dublin, Ireland\'s capital was founded by the Vikings in 988 and was originally called Dubh Linn (which means Black Pool in Irish).
The landlocked and mostly mountainous country of Macedonia, in southeastern Europe, proclaimed independence from Yugoslavia in September 1991.
Maoris were the first inhabitants of New Zealand, arriving on the islands in about 1000. Maori oral history maintains that the Maoris came to the island in seven canoes from other parts of Polynesia.

The Dutch have a saying: "God made the Earth, but the Dutch made Holland." The first defenses against the sea went up some 800 years ago. Today more than 2,400 kilometers (1,491 miles) of dikes shield the low, flat land—almost half of which lies below sea level—from invasion by the North Sea.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa, the eighth most populous country in the world, and the most populous country in the world in which the majority of the population is black.
Norway has some of the highest petrol prices in the world, even though the country is one of the biggest oil exporter in the world.
Peru is the home of the oldest civilizations in the world which was the Norte Chico civilization.
Poland is the 6th most populous and the 6th largest of the 27 member states in the European Union.
Portugal is the oldest country in Europe to have its borders defined just as they are now.

Romania lies on the Black Sea coast of southeastern Europe. The Carpathian Mountains and the Transylvanian Alps divide the country into three physical and historical regions: Wallachia in the south, Moldavia in the northeast, and Transylvania in the country\'s center.
Saudi Arabia is keeper of Islam’s most sacred cities: Mecca, where the Prophet Muhammad received the word of Allah.

The Kingdom of Serbia was formed in 1918, changing its name to Yugoslavia a decade later. In 1989, Slobodan Milosevic, new president of the Serbian Republic, called for Serbian domination, which led to the breakup of Yugoslavia.
Sweden is the 3rd largest EU country in land area, after France and Spain.
The world\'s first constitution was created by a Ukrainian politician Pylyp Orlyk. On April 5th, 1710.

string-array.name: hard_facts
string-array.item: Afghanistan was settled around 7000 B.C. and has been in transition for most of its history.
Albania is one of the poorest countries in Europe (and the only one with a Muslim majority).
Algeria is the second largest country in Africa. Over 1 million Algerians died during the country\'s fight for independence from France which they achieved in 1962.
Andorra\'s capital, Andorra la Vella, is the highest capital city in Europe, being at an elevation of 1023 meters.
Portuguese colony since the 15th century, Angola was the source for millions of slaves sent to Brazil and other places across the Atlantic.
Anguilla\'s total land area of the territory is 91 km2 with a population of approximately 13,500.
Antigua and Barbuda, small islands in the eastern Caribbean, were colonized by the English in 1632. Sugar plantations ruled the economy, and African slaves were brought in as laborers.
The Kingdom of Armenia was the first state to adopt Christianity as its religion, in the early years of the 4th century.
Azerbaijan Democratic Republic was the first successful attempt to establish a democratic and secular republic in the Muslim world.
Bahamas is an archipelago nation of approximately 700 islands, of which 40 are populated. The islands cover an area of about 100,000 square miles.
Bahrain is a small island country with approximately 800,000 inhabitants (2009), located near the western shores of the Persian Gulf and ruled by the Al Khalifa royal family.

Bangladesh is the eighth most populous country and is among the most densely populated countries in the world. The country also has a high poverty rate. However, per-capita (inflation-adjusted) GDP has more than doubled since 1975, and the poverty rate has fallen by 20%% since the early 1990s.

Once a Spanish and Portuguese territorial possession known as Los Barbados, in 1625 it became an English, and later a British, colony.Barbados has an estimated population of 284,589 people, with around 80,000 living in or around Bridgetown, the largest city and the country\'s capital.
Close to 1 million tourists visit Belize annually, 70%% of whom are Americans.

Benin covers an area of approximately 110,000 square kilometers (42,000 sq mi), with a population of approximately 9.05 million. Benin is a tropical, sub-Saharan nation, highly dependent on agriculture, with substantial employment and income arising from subsistence farming.

Botswana is slightly smaller than the US state of Texas. It mainly deals in diamonds and cattle. 70%% of Botswana is desert and the vast majority of its estimated 1.6 million population live along the banks of the river Okavango.

Brunei won its independence in 1984 after almost a century as a British protectorate. Rich in oil and natural gas, the people of this Muslim sultanate enjoy high subsidies and generous health care. Brunei has an absolute monarchy and a hereditary nobility, with the sultan awarding titles to commoners.

Burkina Faso\'s size is 274,200 square kilometers with an estimated population of more than 15,757,000.Formerly called the Republic of Upper Volta, it was renamed on August 4, 1984, by President Thomas Sankara to mean "the land of upright people".
Burma officially the Republic of the Union of Myanmar was part of Britain\'s Indian Empire until 1937, when it became a self-governing colony. Burma gained its independence from Britain in 1948.
Burundi is one of the ten poorest countries in the world. It has the lowest per capita GDP of any nation in the world. Burundi\'s main exports include coffee and sugar.

Cambodia is a country in Southeast Asia that borders Thailand to the west and northwest, Laos to the northeast, Vietnam to the east, and the Gulf of Thailand to the southwest. The geography of Cambodia is dominated by the Mekong River (Tonlй Mйkong) and Tonlй Sap lake.

Cameroon is home to over 200 different linguistic groups and that is why it is known as ‘Africa in miniature’. Cameroon\'s population at 19,522,000 and it has a high level of religious freedom and diversity.
The Republic of Cape Verde is an island country, spanning an archipelago of 10 islands located in the central Atlantic Ocean, 570 kilometers off the coast of Western Africa.

Deep in the heart of the continent, the Central African Republic was part of French Equatorial Africa before independence in 1960. It is one of the world\'s least developed countries, with most of the population engaged in subsistence farming.

Chad is about 85%% the size of Alaska. Its neighbors are Niger, Libya, the Sudan, the Central African Republic, Cameroon, and Nigeria. Lake Chad, from which the country gets its name, lies on the western border with Niger and Nigeria. In the north is a desert that runs into the Sahara.

At 1,862 km2 (719 sq mi) the Comoros is the third-smallest African nation by area. With a population estimated at 798,000, it is the sixth-smallest African nation by population although it has one of the highest population densities in Africa.

The Congo is situated in west-central Africa astride the equator. It borders Gabon, Cameroon, the Central African Republic, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and the Angola exclave of Cabinda, with a short stretch of coast on the South Atlantic. Its area is nearly three times that of Pennsylvania. Most of the inland is tropical rain forest, drained by tributaries of the Congo River.

Cyprus gained independence in 1960. The country had previously been controlled by Great Britain and joined the British Commonwealth in 1961, meaning that Cyprus sends a team to the Commonwealth Games every four years.
Dominica officially the Commonwealth of Dominica, is an island nation in the Caribbean Sea. Its size is 750 square kilometers and has an estimated population of 72,500.
The Dominican Republic has more than 9 million people.It shares the island of Hispaniola in the Caribbean with the nation of Haiti, once served as a Spanish colony. Spanish is the primary language.

Ecuador\'s name comes from the Equator, which divides it unequally, putting most of the country in the Southern Hemisphere. It may be the smallest Andean country, but it has four distinct and contrasting regions.
Egypt is The world\'s original tourist destination, the seat of thought and influence in the Arab world and the first Arab country to make peace with Israel.
El Salvador is the smallest but most densely populated country in Central America. Located between Guatemala and Honduras, it also has over 300 km of coastline on the North Pacific Ocean.

Equatorial Guinea with an area of 28,000 square kilometers (11,000 sq mi) it is one of the smallest countries in continental Africa. It is also the most prosperous however, the wealth is concentrated in government and elite hands.
Eritrea is a country in the Horn of Africa. The capital is Asmara. Eritrea\'s size is approximately 117,600 km2 (45,406 sq mi) with an estimated population of 5 million.
Ethiopia is the birthplace of coffee and they have official coffee ceremonies in the home. If you are offered coffee, it is very rude to decline.

Fiji Islands is an archipelago that consists of 322 islands and 522 smaller islets, lying in the Pacific Ocean, not far from Australia and New Zealand. Kayaking, rainforest treks, mountain biking, snorkeling and diving along with lush green surroundings and fabulous sea-bed offered by this dreamy island fulfills every visitor’s desire of having a matchless holiday.
Gabon covers a land area of nearly 270,000 kmІ and has an estimated population of 1,500,000. Its capital and largest city is Libreville.
Gambia is the smallest country on mainland Africa. Its size is almost 10,500 kmІ with an estimated population of 1,700,000.
Georgia contains two de facto independent regions, Abkhazia and South Ossetia, which Georgia considers to be occupied by Russia.

Ghana is a big country but not the biggest in Africa, it is around the size of Great Britain. The word Ghana means Warrior King and was the title awarded to the kings of the medieval West African Ghana Empire.

Gibraltar was listed as the 5th most stable and prosperous British Territory, in a one-year investigation of 235 countries and territories. It is a peninsula of 6.843 square kilometers and home to almost 30,000 Gibraltarians and other nationalities.

Grenada is an island country and Commonwealth Realm consisting of the island of Grenada and six smaller islands at the southern end of the Grenadines in the southeastern Caribbean Sea. Its size is 344 square kilometers (133 sq mi), with an estimated population of 110,000.

There are men in Guam whose full-time job is to travel the countryside and deflower young virgins, who pay them for the privilege of having sex for the first time.Reason: under Guam law, it is expressly forbidden for virgins to marry.

Almost all of the Guatemala Indians are descendents of the Mayan Culture. They live in towns or small settlements scattered across the country. Each of these groups has developed customs and colorful costumes in their communities that are totally individual and separate from each other.

The Republic of Guinea-Bissau is a country in West Africa. It covers 36,125 kmІ (nearly 14,000 sq mi) with an estimated population of 1,600,000. Only 14%% of the population speaks the official language, Portuguese.
Guinea\'s 10 million people belong to twenty-four ethnic groups. The most prominent groups are the Fula, Mandinka, and Susu.

Guyana is a sovereign state on the northern coast of South America that is culturally part of the Anglophone Caribbean. Guyana has been a former colony of the British, Dutch, French and for 200 years the Spanish.
Even BEFORE the earthquake, 1 in every 3 of Haiti’s kids die before the age of 5 years.

Honduras is the poorest nation in Central America. Campesinos or farmers work plots of land and live in rural areas made up of small villages. Approximately half of all the adults are illiterate even though by law, children must attend school until the age of 15.

As one of the world\'s leading international financial centers, Hong Kong has a major capitalist service economy characterized by low taxation and free trade, and the currency, Hong Kong dollar, is the ninth most traded currency in the world.
Indonesia comprises 17,508 islands.Three of the ten largest islands in the world are found here.The biggest island in Indonesia is Sumatra.

The Isle of Man is a self-governing British Crown Dependency, located in the Irish Sea between the islands of Great Britain and Ireland, within the British Isles. The island has been inhabited since before 6500 BC and now is a home to 80,058 people
Hong Kong has more Rolls Royce’s per person than any other city in the world.
The word “Bhutan” translates to “Land of the Thunder Dragon.” It earned the nickname because of the fierce storms that often roll in from the Himalayas.
Djibouti is the 3rd smallest country on the African continent, after The Gambia and Swaziland. As of 2005, Djibouti has the least number of people on the African continent.
Greenland is the largest non-continental island in the world with an area of 2,166,086 sq. km.

Jersey has numerous residents born outside Jersey; 47%% of the population are not native to the island. The total population is nearly 88,000. Thirty percent of the population is concentrated in Saint Helier, the island\'s only town.
According to the World Tourism and Trade Council 2004 report, Montenegro is the fastest growing tourist destination in the World.
With 5,637 kilometers of coastline and more than 1,518 islands, Panama has more beaches than one can imagine. No wonder it is among the top retirement locations in the world.

French is the official language in Senegal, but really only used regularly by a minority of Senegalese who were educated in colonial-style schools of French origin. Most people speak their own ethnic language.
According to historians, Damascus, the capital of Syria, is the oldest inhabited city in the world as it has continuous been inhabited for more than 4,000 years.

The national flag of Jordan shows equally spaced, horizontal bands of black, white, and green, with a red triangle at the hoist. In the center of the red triangle, there is a seven point white star, the points representing the seven opening verses of the Koran.
Kazakhstan has the main launch site for Soviet and Russian space exploration at Baikonur, the world\'s oldest and largest operational space launch facility.
There are 70 tribes in Kenya. The Kikuyu tribe is the biggest with 20%% of the population.
In the last 30 years, the temperature of the water in Kuwait Bay has increased by .6 degrees per decade. This is three times faster than the global average rate.
The flag of Kyrgyzstan displays a tunduk (seen from below), the crown of a yurt, the traditional nomadic house of the Kyrgyz people.

The Plain of Jars in Laos is home to nearly thousands of huge stone jars, each of which is large enough to hold a person. The largest jar weighs over six tons! Estimated at about 2,000 years old, the purpose of the jars along with their makers is still a mystery.

Official language in Latvia is Latvian. It’s not Russian, not even similar. But there are lot of Russian speaking people in Latvia, that’s why the mistaken suggestion that “all Latvians speak Russian” or “Latvians are Russians”.
Lebanon is the country that has the most books written about it.

Lesotho is the only constitutional monarchy in Africa. The current king is His Majesty King Letsie III who was crowned for the second time in 1996, having briefly ruled in place of his father during a constitutional crisis prior to that.
Liberia was one of the more stable African countries until the civil war broke out in 1989, which witnessed the brutal massacre of over 200,000 Liberians across seven years.
The Libyan Desert covers most of Libya. It is very arid and, in some places, it only rains once ever 10 or more years!
Liechtenstein upholds a stance of military neutrality, and remains one of the few countries in the world to not have a Defense Force. Other such countries include Andorra and Costa Rica.
By the end of the fourteenth century, Lithuania was the largest country in Europe.
Luxembourg is the least populated country in the European Union, with only 465,000 inhabitants. It is also the 20th smallest of all the 194 independent countries in the world.
After Las Vegas, Macau is one of the biggest gambling areas in the world. In fact, gambling is even legalized in Macau.
Ninety percent of the plants and animals found on the island of Madagascar evolved there and nowhere else.
The origin of the name Malawi remains unclear; it is held to be either derived from that of southern tribes, or noting the "glitter of the sun rising across the lake" (as seen in its flag).
Malaysia is home to 14,500 species of flowering plants and trees, more than 200 species of mammals, 600 species of bids, 140 species of snakes and 60 species of lizards.
In 2008 Maldives was ranked second as the best country brand for natural beauty and third as best country brand for resort and lodging options.
Kids in Mali only go to school for 2 years.

There are over 350 churches on the Maltese islands. Many were built in the seventeenth century, making them sights to behold even for non-believers. With their bell towers and domes, the churches are an integral part of the Maltese skyline.

It is a known fact that the Marshall Islands comprise two parallel island groups. However, only a few people are aware of the fact that the island groups are called the Ratak Chain and the Ralik Chain. The name Ratak translates to sunrise and the name Ralik translates to sunset.

Mauritania was one of the last countries in the world to officially abolish slavery. It passed a law prohibiting slavery in 1981. Slavery in Mauritania was mainly by Mauritanian Arabs enslaving indigenous black Mauritanians.

Mauritius is one of the leading tourist destinations in Africa, receiving about 7000,000 visitors with some of the finest beach in the Indian ocean such as Grand Bay, Pereybere, Belle Mare, Blue Bay, La Morne and Tamarin and Flic en Flac, Mauritius makes for an idyllic tropical holiday.
The name Micronesia derives from the Greek mikros, meaning small, and nesos, meaning island. The term was first proposed to distinguish the region in 1831 by Jules Dumont d\'Urville.

Moldova is better known for its wines. For many years, the general occupation of majority of people in the country was related to wine making and viticulture. The major and well-established industry in this country is none other than the wine industry. The country has vineyard area of 360,000 acres.
The Grimaldi family has ruled for more than 600 years before Monaco officially became a sovereign state. The royal family name comes from its Genoese founder, Grimaldo.
In Mongolia there are 13 times more horses than people.

Montserrat is known as the Emerald Isle of the Caribbean. In recent years the island has experienced extensive volcanic activity and in 1995 the eruption of the Sourfriere Hills volcano forced mass exodus from Montserrat.
Morocco is situated in North Africa and it is the only African country that is presently not a member of the ‘African Union’.

In 2002, a severe drought hit many central and southern parts of the country, including previously flood-stricken areas. Poverty remains widespread, with more than 50%% of Mozambicans living on less than $1 a day.
The capital of Namibia is Windhoek. The name Windhoek is of Dutch origin meaning \'corner of wind\'. Windhoek is located on Namibia central high plateau region.
Nauru has no capital and is the world\'s only independent republic not to have one. Yaren is the island\'s largest city with about 1,200 people.
There are eight peaks with a total of 19 points above 8000 metres in Nepal.
The nickel boom in the 1960\'s helped New Caledonia grow very rapidly. New Caledonia also has 25%% of the world\'s nickel reserves, most of which is traded with France and Japan.
Nicaragua is larger then Ireland and Portugal put together.
Niger obtained its independence from France in 1960 after 50 years of rule. Niger has continued to rely heavily on France for economic support.
Niue, one of the world\'s largest coral atolls, is approximately 1500 miles northeast of New Zealand.
In North Korea you can’t turn off the government radio installed in your home, only reduce the volume.
In the past, Oman used to be one of the richest countries in the world, with the wealth mainly originating from the incense trade.
Pakistan has the second largest Muslim population in the world. It is second to Indonesia.
Even though shirts and other forms of clothing are widely used in the islands, the traditional local women still go topless inside their homes - some do so around their village.
There are more than 800 different languages spoken in Papua New Guinea
Paraguay got it’s independence in 1811, may the 14th. Before it was colonized by the Spanish, the land was ruled by an old tribe, which called it self, the Guarani.
The Philippines is the world\'s 3rd largest English-speaking nation, next to the USA and the UK.

Puerto Rico, also known as the \'Island of Enchantment\' comprises an archipelago that includes the main Puerto Rico island and other small islands. The Puerto Rico archipelago is 100 miles long by 35 miles wide and is inhabited with over 3.9 million people.

Sheikh Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani is the current ruling Emir of the State of Qatar. According to Forbes, he became ruler in 1995 after ousting his father in a bloodless coup, and is worth an estimated $2 billion.
Rwanda is the most densely populated country in Africa.

Saint Helena named after St Helena of Constantinople, is an island of volcanic origin in the South Atlantic Ocean. he British used the island as a place of exile, most notably for Napoleon I, Dinuzulu kaCetshwayo and more than 5,000 Boer prisoners.
Saint Kitts and Nevis is the smallest sovereign state in the Americas, in both area and population.
St. Lucia is an island state located in the Caribbean Sea. The island was formed as the result of volcanic activity and is just 27 miles long and 14 miles across at the point of maximum width.
As a part of the Netherlands Antilles and the Kingdom of the Netherlands, St. Maarten boasts 77 different nationalities.

Saint Pierre and Miquelon is a group of small French islands in the North Atlantic Ocean, the main islands being Saint Pierre and Miquelon, south of the Canadian province of Newfoundland and Labrador.
The tourism industry has won St. Vincent and the Grenadines the Best Sailing & Yachting Island of The Year award for the year 2009.
Samoans are known throughout Polynesia as the "happy people" because of their enjoyment of life and their good-spirited nature.
San Marino is the world\'s oldest republic. According to tradition, it was founded by a Christian stonemason named Marino in 301 A.D.
Sao Tome and Principe is Africas smallest state and situated in the gulf of Guinea in western Africa.
Seychelles granite islands are the oldest islands in the world. They are different from Mauritius and Reunion Islands. The latter are volcanic while Seychelles is made of ancient granite.
On February 14, 1972, Sierra Leone made headlines when the world\'s third-largest gem-quality diamond – called the "Star of Sierra Leone" – was discovered in Koidu.

Symbolism of the National Flag: Red symbolizes universal brotherhood and equality of man while white signifies purity and virtue. The crescent moon represents a young nation on the rise and the five stars signify the ideals of democracy, peace, progress, justice and equality.
90%% of Slovaks have completed at least secondary education - the highest score in the EU (along with Poles, Czechs, and Slovenes).

The Slovenian language is one of the most archaic languages in Europe and in the world. It is the only EU official language which has the Dual. In addition, it has the most dialects given the number of inhabitants.

The Solomon Islands are a remote and unspoilt travel destination, with a slowly developing tourist industry. The superb marine life in the surrounding waters makes the islands an excellent destination for diving
Somalia has one of the lowest HIV infection rates in Africa, but close to 35%% of all children born in Somalia die before they are five years old due to disease and dehydration.
South Africa is the second largest exporter of fruit in the world.
South Georgia is a remote and inhospitable collection of islands, consisting of South Georgia and a chain of smaller islands, the South Sandwich Islands.

The Sri Lankan flag is the only one in the world to recognize different religious groups. The yellow border and pipul leaves symbolise Buddhism which is the main religion in the country. As well as this the green and saffron bands represent the country’s Muslim and Hindu Tamil communities.
A girl born in southern Sudan has a better chance of dying during pregnancy or childbirth than of completing primary school.
Suriname is the smallest sovereign state in South America. The former name of Suriname is Nederland Guyana or Netherlands Guiana or Dutch Guiana.
Polygamy is an accepted part of Swaziland\'s tradition and is still legal (but very rarely practiced today).
Taiwan is sometimes called “Ilha Formosa,” which means “beautiful island” in Portuguese. Portuguese sailors gave Taiwan this name in the sixteenth century.

The civil war in Tajikistan began in 1992 with protesters who were against the presidential elections and who felt they were not fairly represented in the country. On June 26, 1997, the two sides came to an agreement and a peace accord was signed, ending the fighting. Over 50,000 were estimated to have been killed during the war.
One in ten Tanzanians is living with HIV/AIDS. The crisis has left nearly 1 million children orphaned.
The Orchid is Thailand’s best flowering export. Exports of the Orchid are valued at US$250million per annum.

According to the Constitution of the Democratic Republic of Timor Leste, the yellow triangle represents "the traces of colonialism in East Timor\'s History"; the black triangle represents "the obscurantism that needs to be overcome"; the red base of the flag represents "the struggle for national liberation"; whilst the star, or "the light that guides", is white to represent peace.
5.5 million people live in Togo. Life expectancy is around 57 years. Birth rate is on average 5 children per woman. Literacy rate is just over 60%%.
Tonga is an archipelago of 172 islands in the South Pacific, most of which are uninhabited, covering an area of 7700 sq km (3000 sq miles).
Tobago was the location of the book "Robinson Crusoe" by Daniel Defoe, and is also believed to be the place Robert Louis Stevenson had in mind when he wrote Treasure Island.
Tunisia has served as a popular location for some of Hollywood\'s biggest films, among which include Star wars, Jesus of Nazareth, The English Patient and Raiders of the Lost Ark.

Turkmenistan possesses the world\'s fourth largest reserves of natural gas resources. Although it is wealthy in natural resources in certain areas, most of the country is covered by the Karakum (Black Sand) Desert.

Tuvalu formerly known as the Ellice Islands, is a Polynesian island nation located in the Pacific Ocean, midway between Hawaii and Australia. Its nearest neighbors are Kiribati, Nauru, Samoa and Fiji. It comprises four reef islands and five true atolls.
About half the population in Uganda live on less that US$1.25 per day.
The United Arab Emirates consists of seven states, termed emirates (because they are ruled by emirs), which are Abu Dhabi, Ajman, Dubai, Fujairah, Ras al-Khaimah, Sharjah and Umm al-Quwain.

The largest note in Uzbekistan is 1000 sym, which is worth about 0.60 EUR. Changing foreign currency inevitably leaves you with impressive stacks of notes to carry around, making wallets all but useless.
Vanuatu is one of the most diverse countries in the world. The word "Vanuatu" means \'Land Eternal\', so apt for this beautiful, unspoilt paradise.
Venezuela has had more Miss Universes and Miss Worlds than any other country.
Vietnam is shaped like a narrow \'S\'. Even though Vietnam is 1,650 kilometers (1,031 miles) from north to south, the country gets as narrow as 50 kilometers (31 miles) across.
Tourism is Virgin Islands\' primary industry in the islands in terms of both economics and employment. There are over 2 million visitors per year.
Yemen\'s border countries are Saudi Arabia and Oman. A short stretch of sea separates it from Djibouti. The country\'s population is roughly about 21 million.
Just over 11 million people live in Zambia. Life expectancy is around 39 years. Birth rate is on average 5.47 per woman. 16.5%% of the population is believed to have HIV/AIDS.
The name Zimbabwe derives from “Dzimba dza mabwe,” meaning “great houses of stone” in the Shona language.
